item.title: Why variable name cannot start with a number?
item.description: There are certain rules when declaring a variable like there should no spaces in a variable name, only special character that be used is _ (underscore) and it cannot start with a number and few others. Lets focus on, why a varibale name cannot start with a number? Short answer - The compiler may confuse it a number literal i.e. it might not be able to differentiate between whether it’s a variable name or a number value.
